sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
Philanax Anglicus, or, A Christian caveat for all kings, princes & prelates how they entrust a sort of pretended Protestants of integrity, or suffer them to commix with their respective governments : shewing plainly from the principles of all their predecessours, that it is impossible to be at the same time Presbyterians, and not rebells : with a compendious draught of their portraictures and petigree done to the life, by their own doctors dead hands, perfectly delineating their birth, breeding, bloody practices, and prodigious theorems against monarchy / faithfully published by T.B. Janson, Henry, Sir, 1616 or 17-ca. 1684. Pattenson, Matthew. Image of bothe churches. T. B. (Thomas Bellamy)
[50], 123 p.
Printed for Theo. Sadler ..., London : 1663.
First published anonymously before 1663 and taken mainly from Image of bothe churches, Hierusalem and Babel, by Matthew Pattenson; the present edition (subscribed "Thomas Bellamy") corrected and enlarged by Henry Janson. Cf. Halkett & Laing. Attributed to Sir Henry Janson. cf. NUC pre-1956. Reproduction of original in British Musuem.
=======

Janson, Henry, Sir, 1616 or 17-ca. 1684. Pattenson, Matthew. Image of bothe churches. T. B. (Thomas Bellamy)
[50], 123 p.
Printed for Theo. Sadler ..., London : 1663.
First published anonymously before 1663 and taken mainly from Image of bothe churches, Hierusalem and Babel, by Matthew Pattenson; the present edition (subscribed "Thomas Bellamy") corrected and enlarged by Henry Janson. Cf. Halkett & Laing. Attributed to Sir Henry Janson. cf. NUC pre-1956. Reproduction of original in British Musuem.
Theo. Sadler
